nodes.bodyText:
The inequality and not-equal language confused me and seems to contradict the SQL docs. I also think later could be misinterpreted as to the right of AND.
I tried to clarify and add an example:

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            * SQL: in case the WHERE clause of an SQL query contains at least two
          
          
            
            comparisons in a conjunction (AND) of which one is an inequality and the other
          
          
            
            is a not-equals, the later can get ignored. The workaround is to substitute the
          
          
            
            non-equals with a `NOT IN` operator.
          
          
            
            The defect has been fixed in {es} 7.10.1, the best resolution is to upgrade to
          
          
            
            that or a later version. More details can be found in issue: {es-issue}65488[#65488].
          
          
            
            * SQL: If a `WHERE` clause contains a comparison (`<=`, `<`, `>=`, `>`)
          
          
            
            condition and an inequality (`!=`, `<>`) condition joined by `AND`, the SQL
          
          
            
            query ignores the inequality condition. For example, the following query ignores
          
          
            
            the `foo != 20` condition:
          
          
            
            +
          
          
            
            [source,sql]
          
          
            
            ----
          
          
            
            SELECT my-field
          
          
            
            FROM my-index-000001
          
          
            
            WHERE foo > 1 AND foo != 20
          
          
            
            ----
          
          
            
            +
          
          
            
            We have fixed this issue in {es} 7.10.1 and later versions. For more details,
          
          
            
            see {es-issue}65488[#65488].
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3,6 +3,16 @@
 
 Also see <<breaking-changes-7.10,Breaking changes in 7.10>>.
 
+[discrete]
+=== Known issues
+
+* SQL: in case the WHERE clause of an SQL query contains at least two
+comparisons in a conjunction (AND) of which one is an inequality and the other
+is a not-equals, the later can get ignored. The workaround is to substitute the
+non-equals with a `NOT IN` operator.
+The defect has been fixed in {es} 7.10.1, the best resolution is to upgrade to
+that or a later version. More details can be found in issue: {es-issue}65488[#65488].

nodes.bodyText:
Thanks for the noting the misalignment in therms, @jrodewig.
I've rephrased the paragraph to better specify the occurring conditions and add back the workaround - which I find relevant and inline with other known issue entries.
I've also left the example out, since we'd then need a corrected example then too and the entry might get large. The GH issue gives examples for both (and links to the resolution too, for whoever would like even more details).
Please have a look and feel free to suggest any further improvements.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3,6 +3,16 @@
 
 Also see <<breaking-changes-7.10,Breaking changes in 7.10>>.
 
+[discrete]
+=== Known issues
+
+* SQL: in case the WHERE clause of an SQL query contains at least two
+comparisons in a conjunction (AND) of which one is an inequality and the other
+is a not-equals, the later can get ignored. The workaround is to substitute the
+non-equals with a `NOT IN` operator.
+The defect has been fixed in {es} 7.10.1, the best resolution is to upgrade to
+that or a later version. More details can be found in issue: {es-issue}65488[#65488].
